Children could use their imagination and creativity to create their own toys from household items such as cardboard boxes, toilet paper rolls, and paper clips.
They could engage in outdoor activities like building forts, playing tag, or having a picnic in the park.
They could explore their environment and discover new things, such as climbing trees or exploring nearby streams.
They could use their imagination to create stories and role-play scenarios, such as having a tea party with stuffed animals or playing house.
They could use their creativity to create art projects, such as painting, drawing, or sculpting.
